message.content: This question requires knowledge about magnification and how it affects our ability to see small objects. Magnification makes a small thing appear larger, therefore, it becomes more easily seen. Option (A) is incorrect because magnification does not make things stuck on metal. Option (B) is incorrect because magnification actually helps us see small things more clearly. Option (C) is incorrect because magnification makes small things appear larger, not smaller.

This question requires knowledge about the concept of magnification. When an object is magnified, it appears larger and more easily seen. Thus, option (D) is the correct answer. Option (A) is incorrect because magnification does not make an object stuck on metal. Option (B) is incorrect because magnification actually makes small things easier to see. Option (C) is incorrect because magnification makes small things appear larger, not tinier.

This question requires knowledge about the effects of magnification on the visibility of objects. Magnification makes a small thing more easily seen because it increases the size of the object, making it larger and more visible to the naked eye or through a microscope. Option (A) is incorrect because magnification does not cause objects to become stuck on metal. Option (B) is incorrect because magnification actually makes small things easier to see. Option (C) is incorrect because magnification does not make small things even tinier, but rather makes them appear larger and more easily seen.
